content:
As Shavez lay in his hospital bed, recovering from the shooting, Emaad couldn't help but feel a mix of emotions. He was relieved that his brother had survived, but he was also overwhelmed by everything that had happened.

One day, as Emaad sat by his brother's bedside, Shavez opened his eyes and looked at him. "Yo man, I saw the light," he said, his voice barely above a whisper. "That was insane."

Emaad was shocked by his brother's words. He didn't know what to make of them, and he couldn't shake the feeling that there was more to the story.

"What do you mean, you saw the light?" Emaad asked, trying to make sense of things.

"I don't know, man," Shavez replied, shaking his head. "I just remember feeling like I was floating through this bright, white space. It was like nothing I've ever experienced before."

Emaad listened in amazement as his brother described his near-death experience. He couldn't believe what he was hearing, and he knew that he would never forget the words that Shavez had spoken.

As the days passed and Shavez made a full recovery, Emaad couldn't help but feel grateful for the second chance that his brother had been given. He knew that they had both been through a lot, but he also knew that they were stronger and more united than ever before. The end.
